text: hello this is Bill Cunningham reporting
from the union square greenmarket and
it's the most marvelous thing on
Saturday after a torturous week or
whatever problems you had to go down
there and you just take a deep breath
and there's all the fresh foods and the
fresh flowers and people are buying
branches their arms are filled with
branches of lilacs of dogwood or
whatever is in bloom that week it's
seeing New Yorkers at their most
down-to-earth human attitude they still
dress but it's not like the usual
studied just their minds are on whatever
they're after and it's wonderful and a
month ago an organization put up a
silver statue of Andy Warhol because
Andy's factory looked down on Union
Square and it wasn't a week before the
kids had decorated it with Campbell's
soup cans with it but probably one of
the nicest things I saw law sanity a
grower had just taken a huge bunch of
puppies and plopped them into an old
plastic container there was nothing
arranged they didn't have a decorator
arranged the flowers it was just nature
and nothing is more beautiful than
nature and there it was right before
your eyes it was wonderful but all
through the market and all through
spring you see people without all their
fashion and all their grandeur and
everything else just normal New Yorkers
down there on a Saturday morning and one
of the highlights for me is seeing all
the little children they're like little
butterflies this time of year with their
wonderful little hats and oh it's just a
delight I mean it just lifts your
spirits up if you're you're feeling down
you just get yourself to the local green
market farmers market whatever the heck
they call it doesn't matter
out in the open and it's simply
wonderful so just enjoy it and know that
this human beautiful quality still
exists in all the goings on in these
modern cities they really put the human
character back in the city I think some
enjoy
